citation.article-title: Solitalea koreensis gen. nov., sp. nov. and the reclassification of [Flexibacter] canadensis as Solitalea canadensis comb. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Solitalea canadensis comb. nov.
Solitalea canadensis (ca.na.den′sis. N.L. fem. adj. canadensis pertaining to Canada, from where the organism was isolated).
The description is identical to that given for [F.] canadensis by Christensen (1980).
In addition, grows in the presence of 0–1 % (w/v) NaCl.

Positive for glucose fermentation, aesculin hydrolysis, gelatin hydrolysis, β-galactosidase and Voges–Proskauer test, and negative for arginine dihydrolase, urease, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase, citrate utilization, H2S production and tryptophan deaminase (API 20NE and API 20E test strips).
Assimilative reactions and enzymic activities are shown in Table 2.
Predominant fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, summed feature 3, iso-C17 : 0 3-OH, anteiso-C15 : 0 and C15 : 1ω6c.
